entry.title: NEWS.am digest: Latest on Pashinyan’s speech in parliament, Armenian MPs not allowed to Karabakh

media:group.media:title: NEWS.am digest: Latest on Pashinyan’s speech in parliament, Armenian MPs not allowed to Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
Armenian News - NEWS.am presents the daily digest of top news as of 12.04.22
ARMENIAN PM https://news.am/eng/news/696327.html Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan addressed the National Assembly today for about an hour while presenting the government's performance in 2021, most of which was about Artsakh, both before the events of the 44-day war, as well as the situation after the war and the future of Artsakh. https://news.am/eng/news/696349.html Pashinyan admitted his guilt and responsibility for both the 44-day Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh) war in the fall of 2020 and defeat, but denied claims by the opposition that he’s handing over land to Azerbaijan. The PM said he’s guilty of not telling the public in 2018-2019 that all of Armenia’s friends expected Armenia to return the seven Karabakh territories and to lower its stated position on Artsakh’s status. https://news.am/eng/news/696337.html Pashinyan confessed that he should have told the public that the international community fully recognized the territorial integrity of Azerbaijan and expected Yerevan to do the same. The Prime Minister admitted that he could have prevented the war, as a result of which we would have the same situation in terms of territory, but without casualties, the number of which, according to the data voiced out by Pashinyan, is 3,825. https://news.am/eng/news/696347.html The Armenian leader also noted that the international community speaks openly about the danger of Armenia being the only country in the world that does not recognize the territorial integrity of Turkey's ally Azerbaijan. According to him, international partners, either directly or indirectly, using the language of diplomacy, make it clear that such a position of official Yerevan is a big threat not only for Karabakh, but also for Armenia itself. https://news.am/eng/news/696356.html Pashinyan reflected on the trilateral meeting held in Brussels on April 6, noting that as a result of that meeting, he agreed that the foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan shall begin preparations for a peace agreement between the two countries. The Prime Minister said that Azerbaijan, however, might try to derail the peace process and use the occasion to launch further aggression against Armenia and Azerbaijan. Pashinyan also noted that Baku might use the border delimitation process to make territorial claims against Armenia. That’s why Armenia agreed in Brussels to set up an Armenia-Azerbaijan bilateral commission on border security by the end of April, the PM added.
RUSSIAN PEACEKEEPERS https://news.am/eng/news/696278.html
OSCE, FORMAT ON KARABAKH https://news.am/eng/news/696272.html
3+3 PLATFORM https://news.am/eng/news/696287.html
VIOLATIONS IN KARABAKH https://news.am/eng/news/696280.html .
WORLD BANK ON ARMENIA https://news.am/eng/news/696238.html
SITUATION IN UKRAINE The latest images from Maxar, which has been tracking the conflict from its satellites, seems to show Russian troops being prepared for redeployment into eastern Ukraine. Meanhile, overnight, US President Joe Biden was forthright in his comments on Russia, calling its activity in Ukraine "genocide". However, French president Emmanuel Macron, who has been a major player in trying to coax Vladimir Putin to pull out of Ukraine, has refused to accept the term. Macron is currently shifting focus to his upcoming election battle with Marine Le Pen, who has taken advantage of her opponent's work on Russia to shift higher up the polls. Meanwhile, ahead of face-to-face meetings with European leaders in Kyiv, Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy spoke to Estonia's parliament. In his virtual address, he once more claimed Russia is using phosphorus bombs in Ukraine, adding "this is clear terror against the civilian population". Zelenskyy also said sanctions on Russia should continue, and reiterated his calls for Ukraine to get EU candidate status.
